conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 400000 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count> 1 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 400000 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Since I need to recover at least the production cost of my resources, I will start by proposing a trade slightly above my production cost to see if Player BLUE is willing to pay that amount or to open negotiations for a counteroffer. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 450000 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Hello Player BLUE, I am looking to sell my resource X which cost me 400,000 ZUP to produce. I believe it has great value, so I'm starting the negotiations at 450,000 ZUP. Let me know if this works for you or if you have a counteroffer in mind. </message>

<other player message> Thank you for your offer. I appreciate the value you've put into producing resource X. I'd like to make a counteroffer that reflects both the production cost and the value you've added, while also considering my budget. How about 410,000 ZUP for the resource? </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 410000 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count> 2 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 400000 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has made a counteroffer of 410,000 ZUP, which is just slightly above my production cost. While it does cover the cost, I would like to make a profit on this transaction. I will propose a trade closer to my initial asking price, but still offering a concession to keep the negotiation moving forward. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 435000 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I appreciate your counteroffer and understand that you have a budget to consider. However, to fairly compensate for the value of resource X and the effort that went into producing it, I'd like to propose a compromise at 435,000 ZUP. I believe this price is fair for both of us. Please let me know your thoughts. </message>

<other player message> I understand the need to find a fair middle ground. Your proposed price of 435,000 ZUP is noted. I would like to propose a new figure of 422,500 ZUP. I believe this strikes a balance between the value of resource X and my budget constraints. Hopefully, this offer meets your expectations for a fair trade. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 422500 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count> 3 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 400000 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has come up with a new offer of 422,500 ZUP. This is a step closer to my last proposal and is above my production cost, which allows for profit. Given that negotiations should end in a compromise that suits both parties and to expedite the trade, I will accept this offer. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your offer of 422,500 ZUP. I believe this is a fair compromise that respects the value of resource X and your budgetary considerations. I accept your offer. Looking forward to finalizing this deal with you. </message>
